question: I am a 61 year old female with type 2 diabetes, diet controlled.  For a few weeks I have developed a strange sensation when lifting anything heavy.  It is an almost orgasmic sensation behind my knees and the medial & posterior sides of the top of my calves.  Have to put my grandson down because it is too intense, although pleasant. Not painful at all.  I have CAD and take multiple meds, and have recently lost 40 pounds on Weight watchers.  I think my diet is excellent.  I take a lotof folic acid for elevated homocysteine. Any thoughts?  Should I move up my MD appointment when is not for a month?
title: Strange posterior thigh sensations when lifting
